image.altText: A closed sign blocking a four-lane road in a city.

props.synopsis: Businesses on the western side of London Circuit, now off-limits for vehicles between Northbourne and Edinburgh Avenues, face a choice of adapting or closing as light rail construction work sees customers decrease.

title.children: Businesses adapt or shut as light rail construction closes London Circuit

image.altText: Eastern brown snake beside a stone wall.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of snakes are moved from backyards, inside homes and other urban areas into reserves and bushland around Canberra each year — but until now, little has been known about what happens to snakes after they’re released.

title.children: Snakes become 'very disoriented', lose weight and get sick when relocated

image.altText: A corpse flower in full bloom.

props.synopsis: The corpse flower at the Australian National Botanic Gardens is at least 15 years old but had never flowered before now.

title.children: 'Smells like dead rat': Corpse flower blooms in Canberra after 15-year wait

image.altText: GettyImages-515649308

props.synopsis: Three decades after the first ordinations of women to the Anglican priesthood, women are still struggling to gain and maintain strong footholds on the rungs of leadership.

title.children: A year ago, Lynda looked around her church. What she found disturbed her

image.altText: Close up of actress Charlize Theron with short blonde hair

props.synopsis: There is an "unprecedented" level of filming activity across the Canberra region at the moment, with Hollywood stars Eric Bana, Charlize Theron and Taron Egerton all in town.

title.children: Charlize Theron in Canberra amid 'unprecedented' level of screen production activity

image.altText: A painting of Rachael Gunn breaking hung on a white gallery wall.

props.synopsis: If there was one notable figure who was going to be parodied in art at this year's Bald Archy, it was always going to be Raygun, whose infamous breakdancing performance at the Paris Olympic Games featured in five entrants' works.

title.children: From Raygun to Dutton, no-one is immune from the satire of the Bald Archy brush

image.altText: Cameron Myers celebrates

props.synopsis: Australian Cameron Myers has continued his flying start to 2025 with a record-breaking performance in the Wanamaker Mile in the US.

title.children: Canberra teenager Myers smashes world under-20 mile record

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flag.

props.synopsis: A Canberra doctor accused of sexually assaulting four young women will walk from custody next week, on the condition he is not left alone with any female staff or patients.

title.children: Canberra doctor accused of sexually assaulting four young women gets bail

image.altText: Jordan Mailata shows off the Australian and Samoan flags after Philadelphia Eagles' Super Bowl win.

props.synopsis: Jordan Mailata's first Super Bowl experience was watching Beyoncé's half-time show in 2017. Now he is a champion, completing one of the greatest sporting triumphs by anyone from Australia.

title.children: Jordan Mailata's Super Bowl win rivals the feats of Cathy Freeman and Cadel Evans

image.altText: Supporters with Woodside protesters

props.synopsis: Three climate activists have been fined for attempting to spray political messages on Woodside boss Meg O'Neill's home, after a Perth magistrate told the trio they had crossed a line by targeting her personally.

title.children: Climate activists shown less leniency after targeting Woodside boss's home

image.altText: A render of apartment buildings over a city skyline.

props.synopsis: The solution to Australia's housing crisis could be building out but government infrastructure can't keep up. It could also be building up but Nimbyism is looking to put a stop to that.

title.children: Is the great Australian dream broken beyond repair?

image.altText: A juvenile coatal taipan snake crawls through grass.

props.synopsis: A woman who was bitten on the back steps of her home is being treated for loss of eyesight and neurological problems.

title.children: Taipan bite leaves north Queensland woman in intensive care

image.altText: A checkout stacked with groceries including tomato sauce and shampoo

props.synopsis: Essential items in remote stores will be price-locked as part of a $50 million federal scheme to slash the cost of groceries in the bush, which can soar to double the price of what's available in capital cities.

title.children: In the bush, groceries can cost twice as much as in the city. Here's why

props.synopsis: Emergency services have rescued more than 20 people from flash flooding across Sydney after the city was drenched by a fast-moving thunderstorm that brought wild weather to large parts of NSW.

title.children: Sydneysiders rescued from flash flooding as wild storm drenches NSW

image.altText: A man stands in a suit and bow tie.

props.synopsis: Nikola Golem has been ordered to stand trial for murder after police alleged he sedated Tomislav Nemes, left him to die and lived in the family home with his corpse for more than a year.

title.children: Stepson to face murder trial after mummified body found in family home

image.altText: The tail of a Virgin Australia plane on the tarmac, with other planes lines up behind it.

props.synopsis: Ilaisa Tanoa Degei, 24, was charged with one count of rape and one count of sexual assault after he allegedly attacked the 21-year-old flight attendant.

title.children: Man accused of raping Virgin crew member in Fiji granted bail

image.altText: Cassius pictured at a horse track

props.synopsis: The death of Perth schoolboy Cassius Turvey was "the end point of a complex series of events" that had "nothing to do with him", WA's Supreme Court is told at the start of the trial of the four people accused of his murder.

title.children: Cassius Turvey's murder trial told 'petty grievances' led to his death

image.altText: A man wearing a suit and tie with sunglasses and a covid face mask

props.synopsis: Former NSW Police officer, Jordan Weston, has been sentenced to multiple community corrections orders after pleading guilty to charges of assault, stalking and intimidation of his ex-partner.

title.children: Former senior officer's behaviour 'breach of trust', judge says in DV sentence

props.synopsis: Around-the-clock coverage of news events as they break, at home and abroad.

title.children: Watch: News Channel

image.altText: A soldier wearing camouflage lies by a tree surrounded by snow in a photo taken by a drone above him.

props.synopsis: Inside a secret bunker with the Ukrainians launching kamikaze drones at Russian troops.

title.children: This Russian soldier has been spotted by a Ukrainian drone. He has nowhere to hide

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton stand next to each other.

props.synopsis: We are watching the demise of a political system where the two major parties once relied on "safe" seats and fought elections in marginal seats that would swing between them.

title.children: We're watching the demise of the two-party system in real time

image.altText: Colourfully wrapped alcohol in a fridge in a liquor store

props.synopsis: Alice Springs businesses say they will voluntarily maintain a minimum alcohol sale price, despite the Northern Territory government's plan to scrap a law that mandates it.

title.children: Alice Springs to voluntarily maintain controversial alcohol floor price

image.altText: A side view of Bryan Adams playing guitar on stage

props.synopsis: Fans are left outraged amid "poor communication" after a sold-out Bryan Adams concert is cancelled hours after it was scheduled to start due to a water blockage outside Perth Arena.

title.children: Bryan Adams fans disappointed after fatberg causes Perth show cancellation

image.altText: Older woman wearing blue shirt and jeans looks out kitchen windows with dull light coming in and a cupboard behind her

props.synopsis: Two-thirds of retired renters are in poverty, according to new analysis from the Grattan Institute, with calls for the major parties to increase Rent Assistance to ease the burden.

title.children: For a decade, Lyn has paid her rent, but she's now living in poverty

image.altText: Firefighter being winched by helicopter near flames.

props.synopsis: With two days of high fire danger expected this week, firefighters battling 16 blazes in Tasmania's west are ramping up efforts, which include multiple helicopters, a C130 Hercules and help from the mainland.

title.children: Air tankers, mainland help to aid Tasmanian firefighting efforts

image.altText: the outside of a casino building

props.synopsis: Day one of the corporate watchdog's case against Star Entertainment has begun in a Sydney court. Former directors and executives face allegations they enabled conduct including dodging security cameras, bringing in cash in esky bags, and hiding the use of Chinese debit cards from National Australia Bank at its Sydney and Brisbane casinos.

title.children: Star casino executives accused of allowing 'illicit' activity to occur

image.altText: A police officer, wearing protective clothing, walks in a backyard behind police tape.

props.synopsis: A detective has told an inquest into the death of a mother of two that there was no evidence to suggest or exclude a homicide despite a second police investigation.

title.children: Inquest begins into death of woman found in NSW backyard

image.altText: A long shot of people carry the coffin in front of the Aga Khan mausoleum Egypt

props.synopsis: Ismaili mourners marched as bells rang during the burial ceremony in Egypt’s southern Aswan province.

title.children: Aga Khan makes final journey to resting place on banks of Nile

image.altText: The fascination that many Australians appear to have with the case of the missing Beaumont children is ethically fraught, as is the media's coverage of it.

props.synopsis: A former factory site linked to the 59-year-old the disappearance of the Beaumont children, which remains one of the nation's most baffling and tragic cold cases, will be searched a third time before being put up for sale, an SA MP says.

title.children: Beaumont children dig prompted by 'new information' about site linked to mystery

image.altText: An e-scooter on fire on a suburban road at night.

props.synopsis: Fire and Rescue NSW has responded to 13 lithium-ion battery fires since February 2.

title.children: More than one battery fire breaking out every day in NSW this month

image.altText: A man stands in front of a tank near Tiananmen Square.

props.synopsis: Behind every unforgettable image lies a lesser-known story — of the people depicted, the events that shaped them, and the photographers who created history.

title.children: The surprising stories behind the world's most iconic photographs

image.altText: people getting off the metro bus

props.synopsis: Public transport patronage is up nearly 20 per cent since the launch of 50c fares, new data shows.

title.children: Queensland's 50c fares have hit the six-month mark. Here's the verdict

image.altText: Abbey McGregor wearing a brown hat and white shirt standing outside

props.synopsis: More than a third of Australians are still working from home, defying a renewed push to get people back into the office post-pandemic.

title.children: Is the push to return to the office actually working?

image.altText: A silhouette of a pregnant woman outside.

props.synopsis: The coronial inquest will investigate whether the baby's death was preventable and the suitability of the home birth.

title.children: Coronial inquest to investigate baby's death after home birth

image.altText: People entering and exiting a subway.

props.synopsis: Many American cities have dire public transport systems, but it hasn't always been this way. How did they get so bad and how does Australia compare?

title.children: The reason public transport in American cities is so bad
